reviews.title: Great Hotel for the Price!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Villa Toscane in May 2004. We already had a booking at the Grand Suisse Et Majestic, but I found a good deal at the Villa Toscana on the internet for only CHF 140 (inclusive of breakfast) for a double room.

Since this was a big difference from the rate at the Grand Suisse Et Majestic (CHF 250 without breakfast) and it was still rated a 4 star, we decided to check the hotel out before we cancelled at the Majestic.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I spent one night in Montreau with my partner. We booked this hotel as we wanted something sceanic close to the lake. Upon arrival, we went to the hotel and had trouble getting in as the door was locked at 2pm with no-one at reception. A guest came and told us that we had to check in at the 5* hotel opposite. So we went across the road and parked up. The concierge told us we cannot use the 5* car park, we must find somewhere else and the Villa Toscane had a few spaces behind the building. We said we would move the car after we had checked in. We checked in then went and parked the car and went to our room.
reviews.title: Rubbish Room Great Breakfast

reviews.text: The bedroom was absolutely tiny with one of the smallest shower rooms we had ever seen. Not what I would expect from a 4* hotel, I have stayed in many comparable 2* hotels. On the plus side, there was a tv and dvd player and the room was very quiete. There was also a computer and printer in the lobby with free internet access.
reviews.title: Excellent value, brilliant location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast the next day which was served at the 5* hotel opposite. This was absolutely fantastic. A huge selection of hot and cold food, all really delicious. I ate so much that we skipped lunch and had a late dinner. There was also a beautiful lake view from the hotel.
reviews.title: Basic Hotel. No frills.

likes.disliked: — Lack of amenities in the hotel

reviews.text: We were free to use the amenities of the 5* hotel such as the pool and sauna but did not get time for this.
reviews.title: Good not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the time of booking, the Villa Toscane was the cheapest hotel in the area at £100/night which is why I booked this place. I think the rooms do not justify the price at all as they are absolutely tiny and not particularly well furnished as I would expect from a 4* hotel. But given the price compared to the competition I would book again if I were to stay in the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a nice classical hotel with friendly staff. It's a short walk from the centre and the walk along the lake has very pretty views!
reviews.title: classical hotel
Nice old Hotel but all facilities moved across the road now.
reviews.text: We went when there's the Christmas market - it was lovely!
The Villa Toscane is certainly a nice old building with character and the rooms, although small (At least ours was, especially the bathroom) are clean and reasonable well appointed.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in Montreux

likes.disliked: — While my room had a small view of Lake Geneve, an ugly, contemporary hotel blocked the rest of the view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can, weather permitting, sit on the public balconies and still get a bit of a view of the lake and mountains, although the Royal Plaza Hotel blocks some of the view.
reviews.title: Tacky and incredibly overpriced.

reviews.text: Now, the not so positive news. The Royal Plaza, opposite the Toscane has acquired this hotel and as a result, there are no services actually based in the building anymore. You have to cross the road to check-in/check-out, eat, drink, swim etc.
reviews.title: Good hotel, stylish architecture, but lake is hardly seen
